title: Comparison of Landings/Catch data
text: recent paper, Link (2021) showed figure depicting catch NEUS region 1950-2014. catch time series represents reported catch every taxa addition estimated illegal unreported landings. methods collection interpolation referenced Reg, Watson (2017) Sea around us also provides data LME also broken species. main differences reported catch separated estimated total catch (also includes illegal unreported catch) methods collection interpolation. area defined LME 278780 km2. Clear differences data sets trends late 60’s though 70s Otherwise similar trends 80s onward. SAU estimates total catch approximately 10% higher Link (post 1980)  Mean percentage increase reported catch (SAUReported) total estimate (SAUAll) = 25.2472791 % SAU data approximately 10.4996812 % higher Link

title: Comparison of Landings/Catch data
text: northeast fisheries science center houses commercial fishing data internally. data used stock assessments. R package comlandr provides interface easily pulling data. comlandr also pulls foreign data NAFO website obtain estimates foreign fleets fishing NEUS LME. Currently comlandr provide estimates discards USA portion data. NEUS LME defined following statistical areas comprises area = 281702 km2. Georges Bank (521, 522, 523, 524, 525, 526, 551, 552, 561, 562) Mid Atlantic Bight (537, 539, 600, 612, 613, 614, 615, 616, 621, 622, 625, 626, 631, 632) Gulf Maine (500, 510, 512, 513, 514, 515) NAFO different designations fishing areas. Divisions represent NEUS LME defined total reported catch less 50% reported SAU/Link Reported landings (comlandr) NEUS LME separated

title: Comparison of Landings/Catch data
text: Several ecosystem overfishing indices (Ryther, Fogarty, Friedland) proposed (Link & Watson (2019)) along specified reference points relating health system. implications incomplete accounting catch apparent assessing ecosystem health using indices. example, Ryther index calculated catch per unit area. Assuming area NEUS LME approximately 280,000 km2, following plot demonstrates ones conclusion regarding ecosystem health differ depending data source. Link & Watson (2019): “… maintain catches level ∼ 3tkm–2 yr–1 (.e. levels excessive EOF) requires incredibly productive ecosystem, sustainable long-term” estimated percentage unreported catch SAU dataset applied comland data estimate represent total comland catch. Ultimately, NEFSC State Ecosystem report ecosystem overfishing indices calculated multiple sub areas within NEUS, namely Georges Bank, Gulf Maine Mid Atlantic Bight. Knowing estimates total NEUS catches line data sources paramount acceptance report.
